meanings.definition: An instance of a particular situation or circumstance.
meanings.sent1: In some cases, students may need extra help with their homework.
meanings.sent2: She always carries her phone in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The case of the missing cat turned out to be a big misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: His smile in that moment was a clear case of pure happiness.
meanings.sent5: The doctor presented a rare medical case to the students for discussion.

meanings.definition: A container designed to hold or protect something.
meanings.sent1: The pencil case is where I keep all my stationery.
meanings.sent2: He bought a new phone case to protect his device.
meanings.sent3: The jewelry case sparkled under the bright lights of the store.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like a fragile glass case, easily shattered.
meanings.sent5: The glass case displayed ancient artifacts from the lost civilization.

meanings.sent1: The lawyer took on a high-profile case involving a famous celebrity.
meanings.sent2: The judge dismissed the case due to lack of evidence.
meanings.sent3: The courtroom was filled with tension during the murder case trial.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to win the case was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The case dragged on for months, causing stress for all parties involved.
